"Why don't you stick around and find out?"



Before we completely move away from what I was talking about I bet Alfred Kinsey is laughing in his grave right now.  His studies were bashed the fuck out of by the public and constantly had people working to invalidate his work, but modern times have proven him right.

It just goes to show that just cause there's a unpopular study that people hate doesn't mean it's automatically wrong.

topics.body:
Since we're talking about a video game excuse me a second while I an hero myself due to the reasons why some people don't like dark souls 2.  Apparently the fail of duty crowd is super bitching about dark souls 2 cause of how difficult the game is.

Now I know why no game ever gets a perfect 100% score; there will always be that 2% of reviewers that wonder why a game doesn't have a "win the game" button.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532b80c56368725e45e30000#post_532b80c56368725e45e30000
That's my problem with reviews when it comes to Sonic games.
Sonic Lost World took a step back from the usual "BOOST TO WIN" gameplay and added more platforming like in the original games. Speed and parkour was there to allow players to be skillful in their runs.

Reviewers complained it was too slow.

For fuck's sake.
topics.author: 515ddf93a4c72d8a1f000d57

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532b81776368725feb700100#post_532b81776368725feb700100
"@ThatRandomGuy42":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532b81df636872692f340100#post_532b81df636872692f340100
Excuse me a second while I
!http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/330/095/918.gif!
(after leveling a city)
Anyways. . .
(ambulance sirens in background)
Anyways that's why no one should give a fuck what video game reviewer companies think.  Some of them can't even so much as actually play video games.  Reviewer companies are so biased that your only option nowadays is to make a game so hard that most reviewers who are used to only playing fail of duty wouldn't be able to get anywhere.  That's probably the only reason why dark souls got a mostly positive review is that the reviewers who don't actually know how to play video games can't get two minutes into the game and thus can't actually make a review.

If dark souls had a easy mode chances are it would have been given a 5/10 instead by "review" companies.
